FeatureExtractor package¶

Module contents¶

class ml_classes.FeatureExtractor.FeatureExtractor(off_scoring_file_name='offensive_draftday.csv', def_scoring_file_name='defensive_draftday.csv')[source]¶

A wrapper class to extract features from the NFL database. This class supports extracting training features with their associated labels and features that need labeling. Replace and extend any of the provided features.

Parameters:
  • off_scoring_file_name – A file name for the source of the scoring breakdown for offensive stats.
  • def_scoring_file_name – A file name for the source of the scoring breakdown for defensive stats.
extract_prediction_features(position, current_season_id)[source]¶

” A method to pull data to be labeled from the database for each player that plays position on current_season_id.

Parameters:
  • position – A string that denoted the position. It is easiest to pass Utilities.Position.<positionName>.
  • current_season_id – An int that represents the seasonId that is being trained on.
Return [(playerId, [locationId, turfId, opp])]:
 

A list of tuples that contain the playerId, label, and feature vector for the season and week represented by current_season_id.
Return []:

If for some reason data can not be pulled from the database.
extract_training_feature(position, current_season_id)[source]¶

A method to pull training data and labels from the database for each player that plays position on current_season_id.

Parameters:
  • position – A string that denoted the position. It is easiest to pass Utilities.Position.<positionName>.
  • current_season_id – An int that represents the seasonId that is being trained on.
Return [(playerId, [label, locationId, turfId, opp])]:
 

A list of tuples that contain the playerId, label, and feature vector for the season and week represented by current_season_id.
Return []:

If for some reason data can not be pulled from the database.
